comment.text:
Was looking for a chill brunch spot in Atlanta and stumbled upon Wylie & Rum. 

First off, the Rum Punch pitchers were so good. I'm not a huge coconut fan but you barely taste it in it. I ordered the chicken & waffles which proved to be a solid choice. My friend went for the shrimp & grits and enjoyed it.

However, the true star was the French toast - an absolute favorite that I'd recommend without hesitation. 10/10 experience and would definitely go back.

Definitely a hidden gem! We found this place on a whim after a workout class, but I'd seen a few others post about on social media so we had to try it. Each person in our party got something different and everyone enjoyed! We had a reservation and were seated quickly, but there were also other tables available! All of the staff was very attentive. Our server Michael told us jokes while we waited for our food, and it came fast! We had:

* Tiki Salmon
* Island vegetarian plate 
* sunny vegan place
* jerk chicken wings
* virgin + regular rum punch
* Caribbean ouay

Everything was good, well seasoned, large portions and great prices. Definitely will be back soon, as a Jamaican -- I approve, the music was great, we wanted to dance!

We came to Wylie and Rum to celebrate my husband being done with a 12-day stretch of working at the hospital pharmacy, and we weren't disappointed! It was very easy to get a table - the place was pretty sparsely populated - so we got sat right away. There is a big screen with a projector in the back, so it seems like it would be a fun place to watch a game (or, if you're me, perhaps the Bachelor?) There is indoor and outdoor seating with fun wall art inside and nice potted plants and outdoor heaters outside.

Our server Ruth was fantastic and checked on us often. I love to get spicy margaritas everywhere I go, so tonight I got the spicy guava margarita, and let me tell you, this isn't just spicy - it is SPICY!! Definitely not for the faint of heart, but this is one of my favorite drinks I've ever had.

My husband got the rum punch, which came in a very cute tiki head glass. I tried a sip of it, and it was deliciously tropical without being overly sweet. For his second drink, he got the Key West lemonade, which he described as "fine... just okay - but easy to drink."

For an appetizer, we got the queso with plantain chips, which went surprisingly well together. The chips were crispy and the queso was hot, and we got plenty of each for the price.

My husband got the big ass burrito, which he'd gotten before, and was just as huge and delicious as he remembered. 

I got the island burger with a slice of grilled pineapple, and a side of fries. They didn't add my pineapple at first, but as soon as I pointed this out, our server was quick to grab me some juicy pineapple fresh off the grill. Though delicious, this jerk burger may have been even spicier than my drink, so I had to go slow and drink water. The fries are battered and crazy delicious. I can't wait to come back and try even more wonderful Cuban dishes here!

photos.caption: Brooks with his "Big Ass Burrito" and rum punch
Rum punch (back) and spicy guava margarita (front)

comment.text: The staff is so friendly especially the guy at the bar with that tattoos on his neck 5 star service!!!! Really good place will come back here

Was seated immediately at lunchtime.

I opted for the recommended Miami Cuban, which I was leaning towards anyway. It was one of the best I've had. 

Because the server thought I had waited longer than I should have on my sandwich and they had run out of the plantain chips he offered me a complementary drink. Unfortunately I was traveling so I asked if I could get an agua fresca instead so he quickly concocted a delicious combination of guava, passion fruit and mango. He also brought me a small glass of fresh pineapple wedges that were perfectly sweet and juicy.

The black beans & rice that replaced the plantain chips were good but paled in comparison to the Cuban and fruit juice.

Service was top notch and he joked that the Caribbean inspired menu stole dishes from pretty much every island.

If the weather was warmer and you didn't look outside you could easily imagine yourself at a rum bar down in the islands.

Definitely would recommend this place and be willing to come back on another trip through the area!

This is a really cute restaurant in East Atlanta with a fabulous, fun staff and great food!  The Cuban sandwiches are delicious, but they have a lot of other good items as well.  The Island Burger with Ghost Pepper cheese is so good and their black beans and rice are great.  I want to try the Big Ass Burrito the next time I visit.  You can call ahead or just order when you show up and soak up the great island vibes.  Such a fun place to go!

owner_replies.comment: Thank You Peggy!!!!!! I’m actually surprised you said too much pork bc we get it both ways sometimes.  Next time you’re in let us know and we’ll hook you up the way you want it!  See you soon!

comment.text: Random stop as we were originally heading to Pretty Little Taco which closed. Great change of plans as the food was great!

owner_replies.comment:
Hey Peter, 
This means a lot to us!  Thank you so much for the great review.  Hopefully we will see you really soon!

comment.text:
For takeout I've gotten the Tostones Supreme with Jackfruit at least 4 times already and it's always good. Most recently I've had the Rasta Pasta and I hope it's a permanent menu item because it's the best tasting Rasta Pasta near midtown! 

The location looks nice inside and I plan to dine-in soon.

It was ok. I have watched the evolution of this plaza since I was a kid. I was excited about a proper rum bar in the city. The service was great. Seated promptly, attentive wait staff, manager stopped by to check on us, clean enough for a sunday night. 

The food was not bad but as someone who really enjoys Cuban, Caribbean, island fare this missed the mark. The Big Ass Burrito was filling and huge. Ibtook about 25% home. The Cuban Sandwich was the best item...ordered it and ate it 2 days later and it was still good. The major L of the night was the Mojo Chicken Plates. Honestly the nerk chicken and mojo chicken taste like the same chicken with a splash of sauce. It's hard to explain. 

All in all, it's not the worst meal I've had but I will not be beating down the door to go again. 

The manager was very receptive to the feedback. This place would be great for a crowd or meet up after kickball, dont feel like cooking weeknight experience. but not a sexy date night vibe. Think casual dining like Fridays but cubanish

I was driving through Edgewood Atlanta and was looking for some good eats and came across this place which I mistook for a real Caribbean restaurant. It's more like American Cuban food. Not very tasty food. Definitely not for you if you're looking for some good west Indian food. Is okay to have a drink but i wouldn't eat here again.  It's more of a touristy spot. Very nice servers and decent parking.

owner_replies.comment:
Please read a summation of our restaurant.  We are not “Real” nor are we authentic Caribbean and it’s literally in our mission statement (literally on Google and our webpage).  A little research would have gotten you over to Bahama Breeze or Flip Flops in no time.  
Also, touristy!?  Hell,  I welcome any tourist at any time and all the time but we’re pretty much locals 24/7 but let them know we’re here because we welcome all.  Next time you bring the score down of an independently owned and operated restaurant please have an actual basis for doing so.  Thanks,
- Management and Staff

comment.text:
This was my first time coming to Wylie and Rum. We sat at a table near the bar. The bartender Audrey was great! She made sure we had what we needed and everything was brought out quickly. Oh and her drinks were good!
We ordered The Cartel, Rum Punch, and Mai Tai for drinks. I didn't care too much for the Mai Tai, but loved everything else.
We got the empanadas for and appetizer. They were so good! For entrees we couldn't decide, so we split the Mojo Chicken Bowl, Tiki Salmon, and the Miami Cuban Sandwich. The sandwich was really good, and I didn't even need to dip it in the sauce it came with. Their fries are super fresh!

Loved it! I visited Wylie and Rum for lunch and the food was delicious. We had jerk chicken empanadas, Cesar salad, jerk chicken wings with black beans, rice, and plantains. The food was delicious, especially the empanadas! The Cesar salad had plantain chips and the croutons were freshly made in-house and so good. I thought the jerk wings were ok, a bit dry/crisp for me, but the person who actually ordered the wings really  liked them. The portions are a nice size.

The drink menu will make you feel like you're on the beach... a lot of tropical, Caribbean inspired drinks. I mean, rum is in the name!

Atmosphere: The bright colors, floor to ceiling windows surrounding the restaurant, Caribbean music, and bench seating gives beach vibes. For a second you might forget you're in ATL... until you see all the traffic on Moreland! There's also patio seating. 

Service: Great

Parking: Free parking lot

Overall: Definitely check them out!

Thanks, David, for responding 5 months later. I never go out to eat for free food or drinks. So just because you discounted a drink doesn't make it all well. My review still stands just like you still stand by your business. There are lots of reviews posted that gave positive feedback about your establishment.  I hope you take the time to give them a thank you for their honest opinion. Just like you took the time to acknowledge mine. I stated that I didn't know your hours because I wasn't trying to come to your establishment.  So I am glad the hours are posted, and I hope that helps the next guest..  but from one business owner to another, Opinions are like assholes, everyone has them. My opinion shouldn't hurt your rating.

owner_replies.comment: Wan, our hours are very clear on Google, on Yelp,  on our website, Grubhub,  UberEats etc.   I imagine if we didn’t serve you we would have gotten a one star review as well.  The fact that the staff stayed and tried to accommodate you,  and as I see on your check,  did in fact comp you the Shrimp Fritters as well as give you half off on your rum punch,  I’m a bit baffled.  For those reading Wan’s review,  we will always try and accommodate everyone,  and as an independently owned and operated restaurant if you have a problem,  we will ALWAYS correct a wrong.  I also urge everyone to understand when you post something here like Wan you are actively damaging an establishment,  and under the above circumstances I feel incredibly unwarranted.

comment.text:
Not an attractive location, the intersection of Moreland Ave SE & Wylie St., at the Eastern edge of Reynoldstown, ZIP 30316.  

Pull on in.  The parking lot is pretty well maintained.  There are other shops.  Small, mostly locally owned.

The interior is just a bit scruffy, not dirty, mind you, just ... unremarkable.  
Staff is pleasant and accommodating.   

I'm fussy about iced tea, I yearn for a glass of strong tea, let's say about the shade of the ATL's own Co-Cola.  Lots of ice!  

The burger can be pricy.  My first visit, 2022, it was $25.   Whoa!   I can remember 5 cent Krystal's in Jacksonville, FL.  

So watch the extras, a plain burger or cheeseburger, with...mustard for me, grilled onions, mayo, the bun lightly toasted.  
Fries are good, don't recall if they come wit da burger.  

So stop by this mid sized Jamaican Joint , y'all, specially if you live in R-Town or, yeah Cabbagetown, Edgewood...

Excellent Rum Punch. Got to meet the owner and he was chill. Loved the jerk chicken bowl - great flavor and the beans and rice were perfect. Also tried the jerk chicken sandwich- must try. I only had a bite, but delicious. Great vibe and very cool decor. Plenty of outdoor seating and indoor. 
Highly recommend. I didn't get any food pics but did get a few of the restaurant. I'll try the pineapple upside down bread pudding next time.

My fam & I recently went to Wylie & Rum. They are a Caribbean kitchen and rum bar that serves Cuban Caribbean inspired dishes. Their dishes are definitely flavorful and the drinks are STRONG!

What we ordered: 
 Chicken & beef empanada (big enough to share w/ a few ppl)

Jerk chicken bowl

Tiki Salmon

 Jerk chicken plate (chicken is huge!)

 Mojo chicken plate 

Rumosa pitcher (had us feeling real good )

All plates come with yellow rice, plantains, black beans, and street corn so definitely generous with their portion sizes. They actually ran out of rice that day so we got fries which were really good by the way. My meal actually came out after everyone else's and I somehow happened to get rice (forgot to take a pic). I ain't gon lie, I was full by then and we went the day before my trip so I froze it and when I came back 2 weeks later and ate it, it tasted just as fresh as when I ordered it! 

As far as service it was lacking a bit and why I'm giving 4 instead of 5 stars. They were actually short staffed and the manager was helping out. In the process of being there our waitress left and another person from the bar picked our table up. We were forgotten about a couple times as we waited for our pitcher for a long time because they forgot to put it in. Once I got my drink though I was fine because I was feeling good lol. It's a pretty chill place and has a relaxing environment. 

The food was really great though and we did enjoy it. Definitely give them a try if you're looking for some flavorful food and good drinks made right!!

I had the Miami Cuban sandwich with black beans and rice. The sandwich was hot and crispy. The mojo sauce that came with the sandwich was delicious! A perfect Cuban sandwich. Beans and rice were topped with fresh chopped tomatoes and pepper and onions. A delightful lunch! Thank you very much.

Had this place book market on Yelp for some time.
Came on a Thursday after 5 pm the restaurant was empty.
Ordered jerk chicken and 1/2 rack of ribs 
Saw on Instagram 1/2 priced margarita so ordered the special margarita which cost me $12 that is not a special or half price

The waitperson was attentive
The jerk chicken was disappointing it was breast that was thin cut the flavor was good but dry, rice clearly from a box plantain was good and corn was good the beans lacked flavor

Ribs is there such a thing as overcooked because yes they were and over sweet 
Was expecting more on reviews and disappointed
We left after 6 pm an still restaurant was empty wider if they will make it
Absolutely delicious food wonderful, ambience, and great service! We come here often. Reasonably priced.

I've had this place in my radar for quite some time and I've been absolutely missing out because this place is absolutely a golden gem! The street corn is sooo flavorful, the mojito chicken is well seasoned and juicy . Patrick was our waiter and has phenomenal customer service. If you're thinking about stopping by ... don't think twice 


Leah

This place was great.  Me and a friend stumbled on this place on a late Wednesday night and it DID NOT DISAPPOINT!!  The Spicy Guava Margarita was excellent and the Jerk Chicken Sandwich was by far one of the best chicken sandwiches that I've ever had.  Our waitress was very nice and expedient and the vibe was very chill and relax.  The bartenders had no problem in telling me how certain drinks were made.  It's a shame that this place doesn't get the recognition it deserves.  Trust me, if you're looking for that "it" in a restaurant, try Wylie's.  I'll most definitely be back and I'll bring a couple more people with me next time.

The service was great and the food was delicious. 

We ordered two kids' meals and 3 adult meals. The meals came at a great time, and our server was patient and took the time to answer all of our questions. My favorite dish was the shrimp and grits. It's a winner!! My son had "the hangover"...   it contains ghost peppers, which he thought he could handle.... he couldn't ... but the server brought him another burger without hesitation. The waffles are delicious, sprinkled with corn and pineapples.  The drinks were also really good. My favorite was "el diablo". It contains ginger beer, which adds a little sweetness and kick.

We decided to give Wylie and Rum a chance some we've driven past and seen the crowd a few times. Although the greeting was very energetic and the staff are friendly, and the ambiance was welcoming as well...however the service wasn't the greatest. 

We sat waiting for an appetizer for well over 25 minutes with a moderate crowd. We were completely understanding of the "new restaurant" hiccups. But at some point the staff has to realize how long a consumer is sitting without being attended to. I'll update the review once the food is served...but for now they aren't doing the best! 

So update, 

The food was delivered after quite sometime. It was good a few dishes weren't hot, but the manager and other staff took over and tried to make a rebound. I have to be honest and say this will most likely be our last trip, just because of the amount of time it took to get our order compared to other guest who arrived at least 30 minutes after our party sat.

Love the decor and the music. The food was delicious and served by a friendly and highly competent server. Thanks, Pat, for making our 1st time memorable!  We started with the Tostones ( they didn't last long, hence the late pic). My mom had the Jerk Chicken sandwich and I had the Mojo Chicken platter. Everything was seasoned just right. The chicken was juicy and just so, so good. We will be back.

photos.caption: Jerk Chicken sandwich with a side of street corn.

owner_replies.comment: Hey CS!  Thank you for the kind words.  It’s greatly appreciated!!  Have a wonderful New Year and hope to see you again very soon!

comment.text: My daughter and I stopped by, wanting to try something new. I had been wanting to try it for a while. Nice decor and extremely friendly staff. The jerk wings are amazing. We had two orders, the tostados supreme with pork were good and so was the tiki salmon. The salmon did get a bit dry toward the middle. We also had the mojo chicken. That was my least favorite. The corn was great but the rice and black beans didn't have much flavoring. I definitely plan to return, if for nothing else but the jerk wings.

I went solo to Wylie and Rum. I sat myself at a table by the door and tried to get the q code menu reader to work without success. (I hate to order using an app. If it's that serious have us order at a counter when we come in and be done with it.) 

Someone saw me struggling though and brought me a menu. I ordered a cocktail and the chicken bowl. The cocktail was fine - bit too heavy on the juice and tart. A lot of traditional tiki drinks are tart but this was unbalanced so it really didn't taste that good. The chicken bowl tasted fine but it wasn't flavorful enough to be worth returning for, and the portion size was smaller than expected. 

This review is 3 stars for the good service and the free parking. I would rate the food as 2 stars. 

Yelp #21 2022

I came in here with no expectations. It is labeled a Trinidadian restaurant but honestly.... I don't taste it. Our server was super chill, I had an issue with my rum punch (it doesn't taste like authentic rum punch but a lot of sugar) and they replaced it with a mojito which wasn't much better (too much soda). I've never had "jerk chicken" taste this way before.... I feel like they need to stop by Negril village or Tastee Spoon to see how it's supposed to taste. Also, the yellow rice had zero flavor. They also took a minute to bring our food out as well and just as long to bring the check. 


I wish I had more positive things to say...
Food was excellent. Only suggestion is that sever wash hands before serving folk food.. Can't have your hands every where and then take ppl their food.

Had a chance to visit. Limited menu but spot on.  Staff are friendly.  

Atmosphere: cool Caribbean vibes. They also have a great patio. In ATL, we love our outdoor seating so this is a good addition to the area. 

Food: Ordered to go. The empanadas (chicken and beef) are not the typical ones I've had but we're flavorful.  The Cuban sandwich is delicious and it comes with a side of rice and beans.  Can't beat the price for this meal. A def must try if you like pork.  

Parking: limited but in the parking lot. Parking nay be a challenge during peak hours.  Street parking may be available. 

Drinks: I should have ordered one while I waited. They all sounded good. Def will get me a rum drink next time.

SO excited to have a great new restaurant in the neighborhood. Cool Caribbean vibe decor, tasty food and rum drinks that match up to the "real thing" at many vacation destinations, and such friendly service. 

This is a brand new restaurant on the corner of Wylie and Moreland in Reynoldstown that is sure to be a great anchor in a new-ish strip of businesses walkable from homes in the area. Ample parking if coming from further away. 
We visited on a Friday night about 1 week into their soft opening and just a day into holding a liquor license. Some of the food and drink options are still pending, but we're looking forward to going back soon. The place was pretty full but not uncomfortably so. Menus and ordering are contactless, and service is pretty quick (I don't recommend ordering entrees until you're close to done with apps). 

We had the rum punch, rum old fashioned, and rum daiquiri - all really tasty, not too too sweet, and the right amount of boozy. The tostones topped with picadillo were really perfect - nice spice and the plantains perfectly crisp but not sliced too thin. The jerk wings are grilled and served with a raspberry sauce. I really enjoyed my Baja chicken bowl, which came on a bed of yellow rice and black beans; the hubs had a 1/2 slab of ribs - very meaty and tasty too. 

All in all - excellent!

photos.caption: Rum punch and rum old fashioned

comment.text:
Obsessed with this spot. The manager was super friendly upon arrival. It's located down the street from my favorite Target. The decor is super adorable and THE DRINKS!!! I loved the rum punch it had like a hint passion fruit but not over powering. 

Everything tasted amazing not just the store bought jerk, and I can say that I'm
Caribbean. This tasted like someone auntie or uncle was in the back cooking it up the jerk Cesar with plantains was an unexpected delight. I was stuffed and didn't have room for dessert but I will definitely be back to try.

Seriously good food!! I am not exaggerating when I say that at age 48 I just tasted the best waffle ever! It was perfect! We came in for brunch on Sunday. The place was not full, so we were able to get a table and get our food real fast. We sat outside: perfect blend of shade, beautiful flowers & plants. We had an amazing time!

Was excited to try this new addition to Reynoldstown. The food was pretty good and reasonably priced. We didn't have any of the cocktails so I can't add anything on that. The pineapple upside down bread pudding was amazing! Service was a little slow so taking a point off for that.

Great food.  Had the Cuban sandwich and rice and beans.  It was wonderful.  My friend had the jerk chicken plate and it was delicious also.  Full bar with drink specials available daily.  Atmosphere is casual and pleasant.  Highly recommend.  And definitely get the brownie or the key lime pie.  They are both phenomenal.

This restaurant is located off of Moreland Ave so entry can be a bit tough, due to busyness of street traffic during peak hours. 

The ambiance is colorful and inviting.  They offer outdoor seating, which is great on a nice day. The outdoor area is also dog-friendly. 

Ordered the drink of the day and it was good! So hats off to the bartender. 

Ordered the Mojo Chicken. I liked the taste of the chicken, Black beans and rice. I was disappointed that the onion and bell pepper medley were overcooked so they didn't compliment the meal. 

My only concern about the restaurant is that I saw three staff members petting dogs, while outside talking to patrons but not coming back into the restaurant and washing their hands. One staff member did have on gloves and when she came back into the restaurant, she took them off. Another server handed me napkins after petting a dog. I discarded them.

owner_replies.comment: I’m sorry this happened and  I understand you may not have wanted to bring it up while dining but feel free to reach out next time you’re in as it’s important we get better.  As you saw,  the food runner/expo and back of the house cooks wear gloves at all times.  I believe this was an aberration and if you can follow up with the date I’d like to check cams and see how egregious it was.  I’m saddened that this was such a turnoff for y’all that it warranted 2 stars. We will do better,  thank you.

comment.text: As I was driving through Moreland Ave, I came across Wylie & Rum and decided to give it a try. I went in with no expectation and left feeling fulfilled. The food was so tasty, I also requested a mocktail version of the rum punch and that was also refreshing. Additionally, I'd recommend this establishment if you're looking for an island experience on the corner of Moreland!

I've been watching this little corner over the past few years wondering what was finally going to come in, and I'm so excited to have a place like this right in my neighborhood! A friend and I stopped by for a weeknight dinner to finally check it out and we were not disappointed. The inside is spacious with plenty of seating and a full bar, with a large patio outside as well. I was pleasantly surprised by the vegetarian options available, and the jackfruit bowls were delicious. We also ordered the loaded tostones, and although the toppings were very similar to what came in the bowl (rice, beans, and protein), the tostones themselves were solid. The staff were friendly and attentive, and the owners stopped by to say hi and were seeking honest feedback. I'm excited to come back and try their cuban sandwich and empanadas, and check out the rum drinks at the bar.

-The food is TASTY! Grab the Chipotle Shrimp dish and your taste buds will sing a lil island song! I haven't had a bad bite there yet & I'm a bi-weekly patron. 
-The ambiance is decent considering the corner they're on (Wylie & Moreland) isn't the most desirable. They worked hard to create a nice, secluded from the street outdoor patio situation. However, Friday night can be interesting as far as the "locals" in the area go. Just do a take-out order!
-Now the service is why it only gets 4's
Word to the wise...ALWAYS CHECK YOUR ORDER BEFORE YOU LEAVE. I think the kitchen gets a bit overwhelmed with the crowds and forgets things. Lol! However, the staff is always nice and super accommodating if something like that happens. Overall, it's a must visit recommendation from me to you! 
You're welcome

Was there a couple days ago for Saturday Brunch and the service was horrible. They were slightly busy but for the size of the restaurant, the staff should have been able to handle it. I saw they had a hiring sign up, so maybe I will try again once they're restaffed. The food had potential but wasn't the best maybe due to the kitchen being overwhelmed.

Yum!!!!!!! Great customer service!! Kisha was professional and is very helpful for first timers. 
Parking is adequate and the drinks were were on point, with the GOOD ICE! iykyk! 
The ambiance is cool. With sufficient outdoor seating as well. The food was good, providing descent size portions. 

I will return.

photos.caption: Ribs!!!! Yum!!! The plantains and other sides were delish too.  The ribs FALL OFF THE BONE!

comment.text: This is me and my hubbys go-to date spot. I really appreciate the island feel. The drinks are always great. The service is A1 as well. Everyone is very attentive. The food really takes you to the islands. My fav is the burrito and the wings. The sauces are all flavorful. We actually travel quite a bit to get here. We will continue to come!
Came here for a quick lunch and got the rum punch pitcher, empanadas, and the Tiki Salmon plate. Everything was good but the empanadas were my favorite!

owner_replies.comment:
Hopefully we’ll be able to earn a few more stars next time in,  however we really do appreciate the kind words:)  if there is anything we can do differently? Please let us know.  Thanks!
-W&R

comment.text:
This place was fantastic!!! There is super limited parking so  Uber. The food is friggin stupid delicious!!! I was not expecting so many bites of flavor and surprises! The ribs are to die for! the chicken empanadas have a tiny touch of sweetness in the dough- trust me you will order multiple rounds! The Mexican street corn is AMaZING! The shrimp and mushrooms - babbeeeeeeee! If you have ever eaten chimpanones guisados ( stewed mushrooms this will take you there). 

The Rum punch is strong and the mojitos are refreshing. Great staff , service is a bit clunky but be patient and they are great! The Ambience is everything so be cool and be ready to eat! Can't wait to go back!

photos.caption: Shrimp and mushroom plate - disrespectfully delicious!

comment.text: Great service for a party of 13 people. Cool vibe and the food is amazing. It was my first time visiting this establishment and I will definitely be coming back.

owner_replies.comment: Thank you so much!  That’s so kind of you to say.  We are so glad that you came in to visit us!!

comment.text: After months of driving past and saying "we need to go there", we finally made it and I'm so glad that we did. The atmosphere was warm and inviting and everything we had was delicious! I got the Big Ass Burrito and it certainly lives up to its name. My partner is vegetarian and got the island plate with jackfruit and loved it. Our friend was in town and they had the jerk chicken plate and said it was amazing, too!

Food was really good. We got the jerk chicken platter. Mojitos we're also awesome. 

For appetizers we got empanadas which I probably wouldn't get again, not because they weren't good, but there is probably a better choice. Jerk wings would be my next choice.

Food soo fresh and delicious...drinks could've, should've  been stronger 
Only reason I wouldn't go back is bad parking

photos.caption: Jerk chicken breakfast bowl  and jerk chicken & waffles, fresh and delicious ...drinks..rum punch and painkiller

owner_replies.comment:
Thank you!!  Don’t forget we also do amazing takeout with pick-up parking.  And I assure you,  we can make your drinks stronger!   Hope to see you soon and all the best, 
W&R

comment.text:
Looks delicious right? It's NOT! Salmon needed the BBQ sauce because it came with absolutely no seasoning- definitely frozen with that pre frozen flavor.

The jerk chicken again had no seasoning beyond the pile of sweet, salty pepper coating- not jerked at all. Even the beans and corn lacked flavor. 

The only thing on the menu worth commenting on is the Mexican street corn- delicious! 
So disappointed.

photos.caption: Salmon, black beans, rice and Mexican street corn

comment.text: The very best Cuban Sandwich this side of Miami.  The Guava BBQ Ribs and Tiki Salmon are amazing too

owner_replies.comment: We appreciate you more than you know!!!

comment.text: So my friend and I were in the Kirkwood area and were looking for a restaurant close by to get a bite to eat. She happened upon Wylie & Rum and remembered she had been wanting to check it out. The restaurant has an island vibe and puts me in the mind of rolling up on a small roadside cafe when on vacation. The menu is a mix of Caribbean and Cuban cuisine. We landed on the rum punch which was highly recommended but was just ok. As a Jamaican, I was expecting the Appleton rum punch that I'm more familiar with but this wasn't that. The food was much better. We ordered the jerk chicken wings as an appetizer and the mojo chicken bowl and Big Ass burrito as entrees. We really enjoyed the wings and burrito. The burrito is HUGE so the name was appropriate! The staff is very friendly and the restaurant to include the restrooms are clean (clean restrooms are always a plus for me). It's definitely a cute spot on Moreland for Caribbean/Cuban inspired food.
